00002  * @brief   Cost matrix functions for the symmetric BTSP.

00004  * Cost matrix transformation functions for the symmetric bottleneck traveling
00005  * salesman problem (SBTSP).

00016 /**
00017  *  @brief  Info for shake type I cost matrix function.
00018  */
00019 typedef struct btsp_shake_1_data
00020 {
00021     int infinity;               /**< value to use for "infinity" */
00022     arrow_problem_info *info;   /**< problem info */
00023     int random_min;             /**< minimum random number generated */
00024     int random_max;             /**< maximum random number generated */
00025     int *random_list;           /**< random list of integers */
00026     int random_list_length;     /**< random list length */
00027 } btsp_shake_1_data;

00139 /****************************************************************************
00140  * Public function implementations
00141  ****************************************************************************/
00142 int
00143 arrow_btsp_fun_basic(int shallow, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00144 {    
00145     fun->data = NULL;
00146     fun->shallow = shallow;
00147     fun->get_cost = btsp_basic_get_cost;
00148     fun->initialize = btsp_basic_initialize;
00149     fun->destruct = btsp_basic_destruct;
00150     fun->feasible = btsp_basic_feasible;
00151     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00152 }
00153 
00154 int
00155 arrow_btsp_fun_shake_1(int shallow, int infinity, 
00156                        int random_min, int random_max,
00157                        arrow_problem_info *info, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00158 {
00159     fun->data = NULL;
00160     if((fun->data = malloc(sizeof(btsp_shake_1_data))) == NULL)
00161     {
00162         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for btsp_shake_i_data");
00163         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00164     }
00165     
00166     btsp_shake_1_data *shake_data = (btsp_shake_1_data *)fun->data;
00167     shake_data->infinity = infinity;
00168     shake_data->info = info;
00169     
00170     shake_data->random_min = random_min;
00171     shake_data->random_max = random_max;
00172     shake_data->random_list_length = info->cost_list_length;
00173     
00174     if(!arrow_util_create_int_array(shake_data->random_list_length,
00175                                     &(shake_data->random_list)))
00176     {
00177         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for random list");
00178         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00179     }
00180     
00181     fun->shallow = shallow;
00182     fun->get_cost = btsp_shake_1_get_cost;
00183     fun->initialize = btsp_shake_1_initialize;
00184     fun->destruct = btsp_shake_1_destruct;
00185     fun->feasible = btsp_basic_feasible;
00186     
00187     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00188 }
00189 
00190 int
00191 arrow_btsp_fun_asym_shift(int shallow, int shift, arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00192 {
00193     fun->data = NULL;
00194     if((fun->data = malloc(sizeof(int))) == NULL)
00195     {
00196         arrow_print_error("Could not allocate memory for int");
00197         return ARROW_FAILURE;
00198     }
00199     
00200     int *shift_data = (int *)fun->data;
00201     *shift_data = shift;
00202         
00203     fun->shallow = shallow;
00204     fun->get_cost = btsp_asym_shift_get_cost;
00205     fun->initialize = btsp_basic_initialize;
00206     fun->destruct = btsp_asym_shift_destruct;
00207     fun->feasible = btsp_asym_shift_feasible;
00208     
00209     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00210 }

00213 /****************************************************************************
00214  * Private function implementations
00215  ****************************************************************************/
00216 int
00217 btsp_basic_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00218                     int min_cost, int max_cost, int i, int j)
00219 {
00220     int cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, i, j);
00221     
00222     if(cost < 0)
00223         return cost;
00224     else if((cost >= min_cost) && (cost <= max_cost))
00225         return 0;
00226     else
00227         return cost;
00228 }

00230 int
00231 btsp_basic_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00232 { 
00233     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00234 }
00235 
00236 void
00237 btsp_basic_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00238 { }
00239 
00240 int
00241 btsp_basic_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem, 
00242                     int min_cost, int max_cost, double tour_length, int *tour)
00243 {    
00244     if(base_problem->fixed_edges > 0)
00245     {
00246         //arrow_debug("Checking for fixed edges...\n");
00247         int i, u, v, cost;
00248         int fixed_edge_count = 0;
00249     
00250         for(i = 0; i < base_problem->size; i++)
00251         {
00252             u = tour[i];
00253             v = tour[(i + 1) % base_problem->size];
00254             cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, u, v);
00255         
00256             if((cost >= 0) && ((cost < min_cost) || (cost > max_cost)))
00257             {
00258                 arrow_debug("%d > C[%d,%d] = %d > %d => non-feasible tour.\n",
00259                             min_cost, u, v, cost, max_cost);
00260                 return ARROW_FALSE;
00261             }
00262            
00263             if(cost < 0)
00264                 fixed_edge_count++;
00265         }
00266 
00267         if(fixed_edge_count < base_problem->fixed_edges)
00268         {
00269             arrow_debug("Not enough fixed edges included in solution.\n");
00270             return ARROW_FALSE;
00271         }
00272     }
00273     
00274     return (tour_length <= 0 ? ARROW_TRUE : ARROW_FALSE);
00275 }
00276 
00277 int
00278 btsp_shake_1_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00279                       int min_cost, int max_cost, int i, int j)
00280 {
00281     btsp_shake_1_data *data = (btsp_shake_1_data *)fun->data;
00282     int cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, i, j);
00283     
00284     if(cost < 0)
00285         return cost;
00286     else if((cost >= min_cost) && (cost <= max_cost))
00287         return 0;
00288     else
00289     {
00290         int pos = -1;
00291         if(!arrow_problem_info_cost_index(data->info, cost, &pos))
00292         {
00293             arrow_print_error("Could not find cost in ordered cost list!");
00294             return data->infinity;
00295         }
00296         return cost + data->random_list[pos];
00297     }        
00298 }
00299 
00300 int
00301 btsp_shake_1_initialize(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00302 { 
00303     int val;
00304     btsp_shake_1_data *data = (btsp_shake_1_data *)fun->data;
00305     
00306     /* Need to generate a new list of random numbers */
00307     arrow_bintree tree;
00308     arrow_bintree_init(&tree);
00309     while(tree.size < data->random_list_length)
00310     {
00311         val = arrow_util_random_between(data->random_min, data->random_max);
00312         arrow_bintree_insert(&tree, val);
00313     }
00314     arrow_bintree_to_array(&tree, data->random_list);
00315     arrow_bintree_destruct(&tree);
00316     
00317     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00318 }
00319 
00320 void
00321 btsp_shake_1_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00322 {
00323     if(fun->data != NULL)
00324     {
00325         btsp_shake_1_data *data = (btsp_shake_1_data *)fun->data;
00326         free(data->random_list);
00327         
00328         free(fun->data);
00329         fun->data = NULL;
00330     }
00331 }
00332 
00333 int
00334 btsp_asym_shift_get_cost(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem,
00335                          int min_cost, int max_cost, int i, int j)
00336 {   
00337     int shift = *((int *)fun->data);
00338     int cost = base_problem->get_cost(base_problem, i, j);
00339     
00340     if(cost < 0)
00341         return 0;
00342     else if((cost >= min_cost) && (cost <= max_cost))
00343         return shift;
00344     else
00345         return cost + shift;
00346 }
00347 
00348 void
00349 btsp_asym_shift_destruct(arrow_btsp_fun *fun)
00350 {
00351     if(fun->data != NULL)
00352     {    
00353         free(fun->data);
00354         fun->data = NULL;
00355     }
00356 }
00357 
00358 int
00359 btsp_asym_shift_feasible(arrow_btsp_fun *fun, arrow_problem *base_problem, 
00360                          int min_cost, int max_cost, double tour_length, int *tour)
00361 {
00362     int shift = *((int *)fun->data);
00363     double actual_tour_length = tour_length - shift * base_problem->size;
00364     return btsp_basic_feasible(fun, base_problem, min_cost, max_cost, actual_tour_length, tour);
00365 }
